item.title: Value added by music in public performance and home copying: economic theory and empirical applications for tariff setting
item.description: You can review the slides here. Value added by music in public performance and home copying: economic theory and empirical applications in tariff setting from DÃ¡niel Antal Contents: 2. 2 Private copying: blank carriers, technology-driven challenges 3. 3 Technological changes coupled with arbitrage opportunities on the Single Market undermine revenue collection in some jurisdictions 4. Benchmarking breaks down if race starts to the bottom. You can adjust your tariffs to the neighbor without in-depth analysis as long your neighbor charges the right amount.
